name: The Culling Of The Cows
description: The Culling Of The Cows is a side-scrolling shooter / tower defence game. You will take the role of Sammy, a soliloquizing schizophrenic farmer with a self prophesied mission to lay waste to the disease spreading over his farm.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 10, 8.1, 8, 7, Vista, XP Processor: Core 2 Duo Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0 Compatible Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Generic Sound Device
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10, 8.1, 8, 7, Vista, XP Processor: Quad core Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0 Compatible Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: Generic Sound Device

reviews.review_text: As others have said, this game feels and plays like a cheap, uninspired flash game. I really don't understand why it has 75% positive reviews; gameplay gets stale by the third level, art is awkward and tacky, main character is the embodiment of stinky Texan redneck stereotypes... I've put 3.3 hours into it, completed 100%, achievements included.   Got it for free and I tell you I'd be angry if I had paid for it. Avoid.
Fun game in short doses at least in the early going. I see the potential for it to get tedious as the levels progress but at a sale price it's worth a try if you like shooter/TD hybirds.
Clumsy controls, annoying voice acting, boring, way too expensive. There are way better games to find out there...
It feels like im playing a demo of a flash game.
I am a farmer, and I can shoot zombie cows.. Best game ever.

The Culling Of The Cows is a lane defense game. The review will be presented in a simplistic 'Pros/Neutral/Cons' format. Pros: * Given away on some free giveaways, so keep an eye out for that. * Simplistic graphics, can be run on anything. * Cow corpses stay there until the end of the mission. (Trust me, it's quite good) * 4 of the 5 achievements can be obtained in the first 30-45 minutes. * No need to focus on the game. * Skills and upgrades.  Neutral: * Hard to tell the live cows from the dead ones later on... (Technically realism?).  Cons: * Last achievement can be obtained in the end of the game, probably about 6-8 hours in the game. * The difficulty curve is just too harsh. * The hitboxes are a bit screwy, I'd suggest shooting slightly above the cow to hit.   Overall: 5/10 (Barely recommended) If I had to pay for this, it'd be 3.5/10
Nominated for The “Best Use Of A Farm Animal” Award :D
Let's Rock&Roll.Die infected cows, DIE!!!!

Redneck Sammy's farm is being invaded by nasty critters. You will need to massacre wave after wave of uglies. Other than your boomstick and some upgrades, you can call in assistance (machine guns, attack choppers, bombs, ...). The game is fairly easy and progresses quickly as more difficult opponents are put against you. However things get boring quickly as you will be doing the same thing over and over again: surviving waves of opponents thrown at you. This would have been a fairly enjoyable experience if it not were for the non reconfigurable qwerty keyboard controls. On an azerty keyboard this adds a lot of complexity and frustration.  Score: 3/10  Pro: + carnage!  Contra: - can't configure keyboard controls

Aside from a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly hard final boss fight which goes on for many, many stages with nary a save or checkpoint, this is one of the flat-out dumbest, funnest games I've ever played. You don't even need to like 2D shooters to dig it (Lord knows I generally don't)! Best wait for a sale, though, as it's a tad steep at thirteen buckeroonies...   Verdict: 9/10.
It's a nice funny game. A little repetitive, but you'll enjoy it during the less than 4 hours you'll need to archieve the 5 archievements the game has.
Has a sentry gun , B-2 spirit bomber , apache and the power to call meteor , nuke , big ♥♥♥ chainsaw ,  Still defend himself with a god damn pump action shotgun   10/10 would reload again
Very good and simple game sometimes hard, but ♥♥♥♥ that ♥♥♥♥ its awsome.

this game is weird but not bad as long as you go in with little expectations, thought its definitly not worth the $13 they want i got it as a random steam key deal with a few other games in reality its worth abour a dollar tops but its an easy fast play through game and kinda addictive i wanted to stop playing but i couldnt...damn nazi ufo

Supricing  Good  Tower Defense game: You playing as Oldman with a Shotgun  +Good design (but brutal) +Playable w/ XBOX360-Controller *Price: maybe not more then 1,69$ *No default screenshot function  78/100 Who want a 2D-Game and using a shotgun is here right.

Wave after wave of undead cows with your shotgun decent for some but just not for me; never been one for a tower defense anyways but after the 4th level it gets repetitive.

'Burn you critters of Satan!'  The Culling of the Cows is action-packed fun with a mighty farmer's shotgun and God in your midst as you take on a horde of demonic mutant cows, birds, bears, humans, and more in a 2D side-scrolling, tower-defense-styled, twitch-shooting kind of game. Just to hear ol' farmer Sammy belt out those lines is worth playing this game.   'Holy Hell, y'all.'  'Get off my dang farm!'   'Give `em the finger, God.'

The music track is really short and the loop is noticeable.  Is it worth 11€? No. Not at all. Is it a nice enough game to get from a bundle/for free? Sure.

Looks like a really bad flash game

Not really a complete game as such, but more or less a suprisingly good one that also happens to include some pretty f****d up cows, crazy farmers and horribly voice acted god.  Now I have to admit, the voice acting as stated before is horrible. But I think of it still as quite a humorous game and it adds up to how much I like it. The upgrades aren't really original same as abilities but still has some potential... if the devs decide to carry the game on.  Pros  - Pretty stupid, the story and the overall design. - Horribly voice acted, which I think is a good thing. - It's fun, as a 5 minute timewaster and nothing more. Expect this to be played for at most 3 hours and then left in your steam library and with the cobwebs growing...  Cons  - Fairly limited gameplay, gets repetitive. - Not completely original, the upgrades, the style of side scrolling defense and the overall feel, makes me wish this was free as a flash game. - Not entirely worth $13 USD, but if you have some money lying around when this is on sale. $3.79 (75% off) is quite the interesting deal.

Yeah ok this is bad. I mean I paid under $2 and I am actually a littled peeved because this should totally just be a free flash game. $12.99?? Are you kidding me?   Graphics are meh, sound is bad (voices must have been recorded on a laptop or similiar), and music is really generic. I was hoping for a dumbed down version of PvZ, but nope, nothing even remotely close. Sloppy controls and an non-intuitive interface result in mostly frustrating gameplay. Even when it is not frustrating, it is boring. I played it with a controller BTW.   Nothing fun at all here for me.

Culling of the Cows is a 2D defense game where you defend your farm from ravenous zombie cows and what nots. It has a large map, achievements and cards. Those usually come as a positive. I got the game for free so I'm pretty satisfied. All around it's quite a solid game, however I entirely disagree with the price tag as it should be lower.   >I'd give it a 7.5/10 >Pros: Solid gameplay, many levels, cards and easy achievements, some sort of minigame levels so it's not the usual defense type, hand drawn(?) graphics, gets challenging. >Cons: Gets a bit boring, reset after death so you start again at wave 1 of the level you're doing, price tag.  ProTip: When starting a level instantly buy your upgrades and try to get a 3$ bonus from the Care Package. Try to go with 1 level in your Z, 2 in your X, 1 in your C and finally get buckshots. Keep restarting until you get a +3$ and you're on for an easy game. Try focusing your earning on the X and Z first.

Only five achievements, all are very easy to obtain.   Fun while it lasted, grab it while it's on sale, because in all honesty, even if it is quite good, it isn't worth the full price.  Gameplay: 7.5/10, Audio: 4.5/10, Replayability: 7/10, Value: 3/10

The Good  It can be fun, there is something about killing zombie cows because God told you to. The levels are short and in wave format so easy it is to play for 10 minutes and then put it down.  Honestly this game feels like it would be at home on Newgrounds.  As I type this Culling of the Cows is $1.29 USD which is about the right price to pick it up at as the normal price of 12.99 is way to much for what you get. If you must pick it up do it on sale.

The Culling of the Cows is kind of like a tower defense game, but not really. It's more like hoard mode or arena mode in various games. Basically, you are a farmer, and you shoot zombie cows. You have to manually reload, so you have to take that into consideration as you shoot. It's interesting, but it's just wave after wave of enemies with no real point but to kill more. The visual style is pixelate and 2D, so it's often hard to judge where the bullets will go. Also, it gets kind of boring and repetative after awhile. It's kind of fun though.

I would recommend this game for 3$ only, there are way much more better games for 12.99$. I got it for free so I'm not complaining, It's a bit fun game that kept me busy for almost 3 hours.  Good: - Zombies! - Gore! - Awesome funny powerups - A bit funny  Bad: - Unforgiving... one fail and you die and start over! And the hit collider isn't making it any easier. Especialy in the last level, you shoot at a cow in front of you but the bullet doesn't hit the cow... then the cow kills you and you start the whole level again, the last boss needs 20 bullets to die but you have to start all over just cause you failed to hit the cow in the invisible small collider!! - Repetitive. - No permanent upgrades to buy??! - Doesn't explain what upgrades do... you have to guess  Overall: 6/10. I repeat... DO NOT BUY IT FOR 12.99$! THAT'S A REDICULOUS PRICE FOR THIS GAME!

The Culling of the Cows is... well bland.  I’m not sure exactly what the genre would be called; you are an old farmer with a shot gun taking out mutant/zombie cows before they can reach the barn behind you. It’s the kind of goofy flash game you would see on Newgrounds back in the day, but not one you would ever be expected to pay for. The movement is a little stiff and the shots don’t actually seem to register correctly about 1/3 of the time, which is exacerbated by the flat south park-esque characters giving you no good indication of depth down range. I played it for around 20 or 30 minutes and was quite bored, then booted it back up when I noticed an announcement on the Library page: Cheat Codes Added. Generally cheat codes end up ruining the fun of a game, but in a game like this maybe skipping to the excitement would keep me engaged for at least a while longer. I activated God Mode, unlocked all the upgrades, and added an MG nest to the top of the barn; awesome right? Except it wasn’t. There wasn’t any big spectacle, the MG was anemic at best, and God Mode only lasted roughly 15 seconds.  I don’t know if I’m missing something or if there are some shady things going on because the overall consensus is Very Positive at the time of writing this. I got this as a free key from some bundle website a while back and I almost regret having it in my library. It functions enough to be acceptable on a flash game website but I’ll be hiding it in my Steam library and never touching it again.
Now in the trash category of my library,
Found this game while being on P0rnHub.

I have fun playing this game, laughing and smiling all the time actually even I suck and have to replay a level a lots, the graphic is cool, sounds are good; plus I get this game for free. But, I would not recommend it for these following reasons:  - Game have 'full controller support' but you can't even config control option. So is not playable for people use AZERTY keyboard. Plus, you have to press R for reloading every single bullet and it will made your index finger tired between moving to D and rapidly pressing R after a while (if it can change to Space button would be nice, but dev gave a middlepinger right in our face).  - Until now, I still don't now what Z,X and C upgrade for (all I now is V get you laser for better aim)? No intruction as far as I remember, too (or I've skipped it, I means ain't nobody got time for that). Hover your mouse on it to show what it do is a basic thing that all game need.   - Talks about mouse, because you aim by moving, so dev should make it keybroad only (for laptop users), or you know, a ♥♥♥♥ING config control option. By made this keyboard and mouse, your left hand have to handle so much things (moving, reloading every ♥♥♥♥ing single bullet, upgrade, call supply, change bullet type) while all your right hand do is right click to shoot (left click to alt-fire but you can only do it when using first type of bullet, and you move so slow which means you gonna stick near your base, far from those cow, which means it's useless for 99% of the time).  ==> Conclusion: There are better flash games out there and they're free. Don't buy this game even 90% off, wait and find free key online. Only buy as gift to ♥♥♥♥ off your Curry friends (which I wouldn't recommend, too).
Haha this game is awsome!

Don't buy this at full price, get it on sale like now or search for free keys. This game not worth the 11 EUR/USD. With more in-game musics, weapons this game could be more interesting, but it is boring after several hours.
I don't know why I like this game, I thought it would be bad, but it's great. Somehow its really fun. If you can get it 50% of, do it. You're definetly going to enjoy it.
The Culling Of The Cows very funny game if you like 2D shooter games.Its have a very easy achivements and collector cards.You are just click and kill cows like a kill zombies.

One of the worst games I've ever played. I can't remember how much money I must have spent on it, but even if you get it for free it's absolutely not worth it.  Controls are rubbish, they cannot be changed.  Item upgrades have no description anywhere, so you just have to guess.  The hit detection is worse than the Holocaust.  You can have power-ups or credits dropped from the sky but, again, nobody tells you that this function exists, or what each one does.  There are cheat codes but they must be entered while you're fighting. You die before you can finish typing.  The content is tiny, very badly done.  The voice acting is one of the worst I've ever seen. And I'm not comparing it to AAA games. No. I mean this is terrible, beyond comparison. If a deaf person heard this game after getting their hearing back, they'd kill the surgeon.  The music lasts 20 seconds and loops infintely, burning your brains out.  There are only 5 achievements and they only require you to press a button. Stupider than Jayden Smith.  It is a very poor copy of Plants vs Zombies, where you have to protect your farm (instead of house) from zombie cows AND normal zombies. But instead of having a strategy you have to remember what 12 different keys do, but also pay attention to how much money you have, otherwise you cannot press them. Plus, some have cooldowns! All of this while you're moving around the map with WASD.  Oh, by the way, you have to reload constantly, but reloading takes LONGER than enemies to kill you. And this is not explained anywhere, either.  It seems it's going to be a joke about rednecks, but it feels like it was made by rednecks instead.  It's not even bloody enough. It feels worse than those flash games from 1997 which took 10 hours to load and then had less features than Pong. Worse than those PowerPoint chain emails they send you, which after 10 minutes of loading and scrolling through endless mail addresses, are not even funny.  At first I thought I should be supportive of an indie game. Maybe they haven't got a clue how to make a game, or they just don't have the team. But I've seen Audiosurf come out of ONE person's work. And it's brilliant. You can't get more indie than Grezzo 2, and it's hilarious. If you want badly-done-on-purpose, there is Goat Simulator. Even Garry's Mod. This is just vomitive. Especially when you consider it's 9 pounds. 9 POUNDS! Which is around 13-15 dollars. For this!!  And no. I don't write reviews lightly. I usually play for at least 20 hours before thinking I can give my opinion (feel free to check my other reviews). But honestly, after 5 minutes, there is nothing else to be seen.  I just spent the following 40 minutes trying to get the last achievement.  I'm really sorry, but for the first time ever, I'm going to award a game a negative score. -1/10 Run. Far.

What a waste of time..  I've got this game as part of a 10 key bundle, and this was my 'premium' game (price wise). This game is an utter joke.  At first I liked the music - A bit 16bit'ish with some nice distortion. It quickly irked me once I realised the distorted sounds where allover the place. And once you get further into the game, the charm of the sad and ugly graphics quickly turns for the worse. The more enemies you kill, the more garbage fills your screen. No explanation of the different ammo types or upgrades, and the stupid assist constantly changes slots. Also, it never mentions that your own 'assist' can kill you >.<  At least you're able to mute the game, make it windowed and idle while doing other stuff (= getting the 5 free cards).  If you got this game as I did (i.e: No refund option) and you want the stupid free cards (and easy 100% achievement) follow the neat guides. One, by the developer, tells you how to open the cheat menu (I could NOT figure out how to do it) but also list all the cheats. One opens up all the worlds - BOOM. Go to last level, use the guide which tells you how to skip the first two sectors and BOOM! Achievement done in less hours than I have spent.  *sigh* I can't believe it took me 3hours of grinding before I finally 'cheated' and went looking at the guides. Save yourselves some time, and just blatantly 'cheat' through the achievements.  Very bad game. Very bad price tag. I sincerly hope you didn't buy this game by your own choice.  Having a boner and no arms > This game.
Best use of a farm animal 10/10
